Package org.ivoa.dm.uws

Class Job

java.lang.Object
org.ivoa.dm.uws.JobSummary
org.ivoa.dm.uws.Job
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.ivoa.vodml.jaxb.XmlIdManagement, org.ivoa.vodml.jpa.JPAManipulations, org.ivoa.vodml.jpa.JPAManipulationsForObjectType<String>
@Entity @VoDml(id="uws:job", role=objectType) public class Job extends JobSummary implements org.ivoa.vodml.jpa.JPAManipulationsForObjectType<String>, org.ivoa.vodml.jaxb.XmlIdManagement
This is the information that is returned when a GET is made for a single job resource - i.e. /{jobs}/{job-id}. objectType: Job

  • Constructor Details

    • Job

      public Job()
      Creates a new job

    • Job

      public Job(String jobId, String runId, String ownerId, ExecutionPhase phase, Date quote, Date creationTime, Date startTime, Date endTime, Integer executionDuration, Date destruction, UWSVersion version, Parameters parameters, Results results, ErrorSummary errorSummary, JobInfo jobInfo)
      full parameter constructor.
      Parameters:
      jobId - .
      runId - this is a client supplied identifier - the UWS system does nothing other than to return it as part of the description of the job .
      ownerId - the owner (creator) of the job - this should be expressed as a string that can be parsed in accordance with IVOA security standards. If there was no authenticated job creator then this should be set to NULL.
      phase - the execution phase - returned at /{jobs}/{job-id}/phase .
      quote - A Quote predicts when the job is likely to complete - returned at /{jobs}/{job-id}/quote 'don't know' is encoded by setting to the XML null value xsi:nil='true' .
      creationTime - The instant at which the job was created. Note that the version 1.1 of the specification requires that this element be present. It is optional only in versions 1.x of the schema for backwards compatibility. 2.0+ versions of the schema will make this formally mandatory in an XML sense.
      startTime - The instant at which the job started execution.
      endTime - The instant at which the job finished execution .
      executionDuration - The duration (in seconds) for which the job should be allowed to run - a value of 0 is intended to mean unlimited - returned at /{jobs}/{job-id}/executionduration .
      destruction - The time at which the whole job + records + results will be destroyed. returned at /{jobs}/{job-id}/destruction .
      version - note that this attribute is actually required by the 1.1 specification - however remains optional in the schema for backwards compatibility. It will be formally required in the next major revision.
      parameters - The parameters to the job (where appropriate) can also be retrieved at /{jobs}/{job-id}/parameters .
      results - The results for the job - can also be retrieved at /{jobs}/{job-id}/results .
      errorSummary - .
      jobInfo - This is arbitrary information that can be added to the job description by the UWS implementation.
